title: Thirukkural – In Praise of her Beauty
---

1114\. காணின் குவளை கவிழ்ந்து நிலன்நோக்கும்<br>
மாணிழை கண்ணொவ்வேம் என்று.

kāṇiṉ kuvaḷai kaviḻntu nilaṉnōkkum<br>
māṇiḻai kaṇṇovvēm eṉṟu.

If it could see her, the blue water lily <br>
would fall over, hang its head in shame, <br>
and say: I can never be a match to the eyes of this beautiful, bejewelled woman.

ఈ కలికి కనులు నీలి కలువ చూసెనా,<br>
‘నేనా మీ సాటి’ యని, సిగ్గిలి తలవంచదా!

1116\. மதியும் மடந்தை முகனும் அறியா<br>
பதியின் கலங்கிய மீன்.

matiyum maṭantai mukaṉum aṟiyā<br>
patiyiṉ kalaṅkiya mīṉ.

Transfixed, shaken up, <br>
the stars sink into confusion, <br>
not knowing how to discern <br>
a full moon from my woman’s face.

నివ్వెరపడి, తమ నెలవులు తప్పి, <br>
కలవర పడవా తారలు, <br>
ఈమె మోమును, నిండు జాబిలిని<br>
ఒకే వేళ చూసి!

Thirukkural<br>
The book of desire by Tiruvalluvar <br>
English Tr. Meena Kandasamy<br>
